# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt  # for visualizing data
import seaborn as sns  # for visualizing data
import missingno as msno   # for visualizing NaN values in dataframe
import plotly.express as px
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

sns.set(style='darkgrid')

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.9d7ea5e1:
data = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/pakistans-top-250-youtube-channels/Pakistan Top 250 YouTube Channels.csv")

# displaying top 10 records
data.head(10)
source.40539833:
msno.bar(data, color="dodgerblue", figsize=(10,5), fontsize = 10)
plt.title("MISSING VALUES IN EACH COLUMN\n", size = 15)
plt.show()
source.b208774c:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.countplot(y = data['Category'], palette='Dark2')
plt.title("TOTAL COUNTS OF EACH CATEGORY\n", size = 15)
plt.show()
source.0aca98f4: px.pie(data_frame = data, names = "Category", hover_data = ['Subscriber'], title = "PERCENTAGE OF CATEGORIES")
source.2c5f5c14:
plt.figure(figsize = (25,10))
sns.barplot(x = "Category", y = "Subscriber",
            data = data,
            ci = None,
           edgecolor = "mediumblue",
           lw = 4)

plt.title("MOST VIEWED CATEGORY IN PAKISTAN\n", size = 30)
plt.xticks(rotation = 45)
plt.xlabel("Category\n", size = 20)
plt.ylabel("Subscribers\n", size = 20)

plt.show()

source.b41937d0:
plt.figure(figsize = (15,8))
sns.barplot(x = "Subscriber", y = "ChannelName",
            data = entairteinment_data.head(10), palette="rainbow")
plt.title("TOP 10 PAKISTANI ENTAIRTEINMENT YOUTUBE CHANNELS\n", size = 15)
plt.show()
